member.name: E:C1.C1PrintDocument.C1PrintDocument.ColumnStarted

member.name: T:C1.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder
member.summary: This interface is used to allow objects and collection to serialize types of their members in a custom way. If a collection implements this interface, TypeToString is invoked during serialization of collection items, and for all items for which it returns a non-null string, that string is used as the element name of the item. If a class implements this interface, AND a member of that class has attribute TypeNameSerialization.Custom, AND does not have attribute XmlAttribute (i.e. is serialized as an element), TypeToString is invoked on the owner when that member is serialized, and if that returns a non-null string, that string is used as the value of TypeName attribute. When deserializing a collection which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked for each new item in the collection, and if that returns a non-null type, that type is used to create the item. Otherwise, TypeNameSerialization attribute is used. When deserializing a class which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked on that class for members with TypeNameSerialization.Custom attribute set.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.TypeToString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string representing the type of the object

member.name: M:C1.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.StringToType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the type restored from the serialized string

The base class for all visible source tree drawels

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocEngine.Src.DrawelBase
member.summary:
The base class for all source tree drawels. Encapsulates the tree structure and the layout functionality of all drawels, and also provides some contants used throughout the source tree. All else (fonts, colors etc.) are in the (also abstract, but less so) Drawel class, which inherits from this.
Notes: All attributes stored in XML (see C1PrintDocument spec) should be implicitly convertible to and from strings which are their xml representation, and should have constructors accepting string argument.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.GetFrameWidthMm
member.summary: Returns a length of a horizontal part of a frame (spacing+borders+padding) in millimeters. Returns an *actual* width, which can differ for some elements from spacing+borders+padding calculated by style values. Actually calculated by the CalcFrameWidthMm method. All internal methods use this method to get a frame width.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.GetFrameHeightMm
member.summary: An analogue of GetFrameWidthMm, but for vertical lenght of the frame. Actually calculated by the CalcFrameHeightMm method.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.CalcFrameWidthMm
member.summary: Calculates an actual length of a horizontal part of a frame, which is retrieved by means of GetFrameWidthMm method. Being called automatically when frame length is changing. Must be overridden for elements whose frame width is determined in other way then the standard one spacing+borders+padding from style.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.CalcFrameHeightMm
member.summary: Analogue of CalcFrameWidthMm for vertical part of frame.

member.summary: Performs generation of RO's content, filling out the content-related properties of passed drawel. This method must be overridden in derived ROs to perform actual generation. NOTES TO INHERITOR: - haven't got to init Width and Height of content drawel - mustn't change GenerationState, but can use it for its purposes - must return only actual necessary space to fit initialized content in the generatedHeightMm parameter
member.param: Maximum available height of drawel content (frames are not included here) in mm.
Returns actual height of generated content needed to fit this content.
The drawel whose conten-related properties must be initialized.
Drawel that will be a parent of content drawel.
Returns an indication of whether the generation of whole content was finished or there is a data that must be generated in the next step.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.SizeInfo
member.summary: Wrap a bunch of properties which are marked as non-browsable for a user.

members.member: EXPLANATION: Actual_XXX_length property bunch. A common model of a width/height of an element is represented by the formula (e.g. for width): width = frame width + content width; frame width = spacing + padding + borders But there are some exceptions concerning frame width, e.g. TableCell whose spacing and border widths are treated as zeros, so an attempt to calculate frame width using values from Style can give wrong result. So the safe way to get valid frame and content width is to use Actual_XXX_length properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.StyleNestedProtected
member.summary: This is a protected implementation of "nested style" property, e.g. StyleNested for RunningTitle, StyleTableCell for table elements.

member.summary: Indicates whether element is in "update mode" (between BeginUpdateInternal/EndUpdateInternal calls pair).

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.UpdateCounter
member.summary: BeginUpdateInternal/EndUpdateInternal reference counter, incremented by BeginUpdateInternal, decremented by EndUpdateInternal.

member.name: E:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.PhysicalSizeChanged
member.summary: IDocumentElement item inplementator

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.DocumentElement.PendingInvalidateAutoSize
member.summary: This flag is set to true by InvalidateAutoSize method when element is in update mode (i.e. between BeginUpdateInternal and EndUpdateInternal calls), insted of to perform auto-size recalculation. Farther, when EndUpdateInternal is being called when update counter becomes 0, and if PendingInvalidateAutoSize is true, it in turn calls InvalidateAutoSize method to force recalculation of an auto-size. Such a mechanism allows to prevent time-consuming recalculations while element is in update mode and to force recalculation on exit from this mode, but only in a case when it's really needed.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl
member.summary:
Base implementation of the IPropertyInheritable interface.
Every class must do: - turn off PropertyChange (or like) events in IsUninheritance() == true state - tune properties' set/get Class with IPropertyInheritable children must do: - set InheritableOwner of children to this - override Assign to take into account IsUninheritance() == true state - override BecameInherited() to propagate IsInherited state - override InheritedFromChanged() to init children's parents

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl.InheritedFromChanged
member.summary: Being called when InheritedFrom property has been changed. Override it to propagate InheritedFrom to children.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl.BecameInherited
member.summary: Being called when IsInherited property has been changed from false to true. Override it to set childrens as inherited

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl.BeginUninheritance
member.summary: Being called when IsInherited property is about to be changed from true to false. Block PropertyChange event and switch assignment to the special mode.

members.member: Being called just after IsInherited property was changed from true to false.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl.IsUninheritance
member.summary: True if between BeginUninheritance/EndUninheritance calls.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.PropertyInheritableImpl.IsInherited
member.summary: When being changed from true to false set InheritableOwner's (if defined) IsInherited to false too.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.ObjectListBase
member.summary: Implements a list of objects with quick removement. It's used as a collection of child elements which needs to receive notifications about events in their parent element via direct method call instead of event handler. Examples of classes that hosts this collection are DocumentElement, C1PrintDocument and C1DocStyle.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.ObjectListBase.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns cookie than is used later in Remove. A client code that adds element into this list must store this cookie so as to pass it later as a parameter of the Remove method. This cookie identify this added object in the list and allows to remove it from the list quickly. Current implementation adds a new object to the end of the internal ArrayList and returns its index as a cookie. The benefit of this approach is a speed, the drawback is that this ArrayList tends to grow. Another possible approach is to store list as a two-way linear list and returns list element as a cookie, but it far less effective in a speed.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.ObjectListBase.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes an object identified by a cookie from the list. See Add method for details. Just set corresponding element of internal ArrayList to null. If it detects that all elements of ArrayList became nulls after this removement then clears ArrayList to prevent infinite growth of the one.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.ObjectListBase.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns enumerator to iterate through the list.

member.summary: Number of elements (including removed, nulls) in a list.

member.summary: Index access to elements

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.RenderControlSmart
member.summary: Represents RO that combines printing capabilitis of RenderControlImage and RenderC1Printable controls. That is, if some control in parent-child hierarchy supports printing via RenderC1Printable it being printed this way, in other case screen image of control is being printed. If C1Printable control is stretched vertically during printing, then parent control's image (even if it's not a C1Printable) is stretched too. IMPORTANT NOTICE: current implementation doesn't support spill over page break.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableCell.IsSpanMaster
member.summary: Indicates whether this cell is *defined* as a starting cell of any span. "Defined" means that SpanColumns or SpanRows property is greater that 1. Actually it doesn't mean that this cell starts some span because there are cases when there is another span with less row or col index which covers this cell. In this case the definition of this cell as a span is ignored. To determine whether this cell starts actual span use IsSpanMasterActual property.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableCell.IsSpanMasterActual
member.summary: Indicates whether this cell is an *actual* starting cell of any span. See IsSpanMaster for details.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableCell.IsSpanSlaveActual
member.summary: Returns true if cell belongs to an *actual* spant but not is a span master. For the explanation of what is "actual span" see IsSpanMaster property description.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.UpdateSpansOnRowAction(System.Int32,System.Int32,C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.RowAction)
member.summary: Update Spans list to make it consistent with specified action performed on band's row. rowIdx is an index of a row in question. newRowIdx is used in conjunction with Moved action only and specifies a new index of the row. Returns true if something has been changed in Spans list, false in other case. PREREQUISITES: SpanSet.Spans must be sorted by row-col. POSTCONDITION: SpanSet.Spans stay sorted by row-col.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.UpdateSpansOnColAction(System.Int32,System.Int32,C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.ColAction)
member.summary: Update Spans list to make it consistent with specified action performed on table's column. colIdx is an index of a column in question. newColIdx is used in conjunction with Moved action only and specifies a new index of the column. Returns true if something has been changed in Spans list, false in other case. PREREQUISITES: SpanSet.Spans must be sorted by row-col. POSTCONDITION: SpanSet.Spans stays sorted by row-col.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.UpdateSpansOnSpanAction(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: Update Spans list to make it consistent with a change of span performed at specified band's cell. Returns true if something has been changed in Spans list, false in other case. deletedSpans returns a list of spans that was deleted, or null if there are no. PREREQUISITES: SpanSet.Spans must be sorted by row-col. POSTCONDITION: SpanSet.Spans stays sorted by row-col.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.TableSpanController.ProcessSpansListChanged(System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Performs all necessary actions after Spans has been changed. deletedSpans is a list of spans (TableSpanDef) that was deleted during change of Spans list (can be null).
removedRowIdx specifies index of removed row, or -1 if not the case. insertedRowIdx specifies index of inserted row, or -1 if not the case. If both removedRowIdx and insertedRowIdx are specified it means that row hass been moved from removedRowIdx to insertedRowIdx.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.UserActionEnum
member.summary: Identifies a single end-user input action which can be handled by a C1Preview form control. Click - The control is clicked. MouseUp - The mouse pointer is over the control and a mouse button is released. MouseDown - The mouse pointer is over the control and a mouse button is pressed. MouseEnter - The mouse pointer enters the control. MouseLeave - The mouse pointer leaves the control. Enter - The input focus enters the control. Leave - The input focus leaves the control.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.ActionHandlerLink

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.InputInfoBase
member.summary: The base abstract class for all input-related features of C1Preview Forms input render objects (controls). InputInfoBase defines the basic properties which are supported by all input controls Value, StatusText, UserActions and so on. Classes derived from RenderInputBase and providing specific controls (such as text box, button etc.) can define derived input info classes specific to the needs of the control. For example, RenderInputButton defines the InputInfoButton class which is derived from InputInfoBase and provides button-specific features.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.InputInfoBase.IsControlNeededParentForWmPrint
member.summary: Some controls process the WM_PRINT message incorrectly if their Parent property is null. Example of such class is a TextBox when its Multiline property is false. The class derived from InputInfoBase must return true in this method if it uses such control.

member.summary: Copies the content of another InputInfoBase object. Attention! this method does not copy the value of Name property.
member.param: The source object, its properties will be copied to this object.

member.name: P:C1.C1PrintDocument.InputInfoBase.HasInputActions
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the InputInfo has any actions associated with it. Checking this property is similar to testing the InputActions.Count, with the following important difference: the InputActions collection is created only when it is needed or accessed, so if a control does not have any associated input actions, using this property is more efficient.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.InputInfoBase.FormForWmPrint
member.summary: Some controls process the WM_PRINT message incorrectly if their Parent property is null. Example of such class is a TextBox when its Multiline property is false. FormForWmPrint is used as a parent form for such classes, this form is invisible and when it is displayed it does not receive an input focus, see FormForWmPrint.Show() method for details.

member.summary: The base class for all C1Preview Forms input render objects (which represent controls on C1Preview forms). Provides the basic functionality for all input controls position, size, visual style, user actions, input options. Adds input-specific features to the display features provided by the base class (position, size, visual style and so on).

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.PrintHelper.MergePageToPrinterSettings(System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings)
member.summary: This method fixes a bug in .NET 1.0/1.1 (not sure about 2.0) method PageSettings.CopyToHdevmode: it copies PaperSize.Height/Width (which are in 1/100 of an inch) to devmode's dmPaperLength/Width (which are in 1/10 mm) "as is", w/out converting the values. This *sometimes* results in printout being cut off at width/height times 2.54.
member.param: PrinterSettings to which the page settings are to be merged.
PageSettings to be merged into PrinterSettings.

member.name: T:C1.C1PrintDocument.Util.PrintDocumentPrintController
member.summary: The .NET PreviewPrintController creates metafiles with gdi+ commands. This is bad for us because the format of such emf records is not documented, and so we can not e.g. search for text. But, if we just use .NET PrintController, the page generation process slows down by a factor of 2 (at least). The only way to avoid this is to inherit from PreviewPrintController but provide our own graphics, based on emf-only metafiles. Another caveat is which base methods to call and which not. Invoking base.OnStartPrint/base.OnEndPrint is necessary because if we do not do that performance is the same as with the regular PrintController (i.e. bad). OTOH, invoking base.OnStartPage/ base.OnEndPage looks like wasting time (as we can not use the provided graphics anyway) and what is more, for big documents at some point seems to drain resources and causes our creation of metailes to fail. So what is below seems to be the only combination that works. Still, the whole printing stuff in .NET is a mess. --dima.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.Util.DefaultPaperSize.GetCurrentLocaleDefaultPaperSize
member.summary:
Returns default paper size based on current system locale. This function uses the same strategy as Add Printer Wizard in choosing of default page size, that is returns value based on LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT LCID.
Implementation notes: this function first attempt to retrieve size using GetLocaleInfo WinApi function, which must succeed on 2000/XP systems. If this attempt failed then it retrieves region descriptor and returns size based on its own knowledge.

member.name: M:C1.C1PrintDocument.Util.DefaultPaperSize.GetDefaultPaperSize
member.summary: Returns the default paper size. If default printer presents in the system then returns its default paper size, otherwise returns size based on the current locale (see GetCurrentLocaleDefaultPaperSize() for details).

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.C1XLBook.PixelsToTwips(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a pixel measurement into twips (1/20th of a point).
member.returns: Measurement in twips.

remarks.para: Excel stores measurements in twips (1/20th of a point), a resolution-independent unit. .NET controls, on the other hand, usually express measurements in pixels. This method provides an easy way to convert pixel measurements into twips using the current screen resolution.

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.C1XLBook.TwipsToPixels(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a twip measurement into screen pixels.
member.returns: Measurement in screen pixels.

remarks.para: Excel stores measurements in twips (1/20th of a point), a resolution-independent unit. .NET controls, on the other hand, usually express measurements in pixels. This method provides an easy way to convert pixel measurements into twips using the current screen resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.C1XLBook.Sheets
member.summary: Gets a collection of objects that represent the worksheets in the .
member.remarks: The returned has methods for counting, enumerating, adding and removing sheets from the .

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.C1XLBook.DefaultFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the default for the .

remarks.para: You can assign any font to any cell using objects. Cells that have no associated custom styles or have styles that do not define a custom font are displayed using the book's default font.
The property is initially set to 10 pt Arial.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.C1XLBook.KeepFormulas
member.summary: Specifies whether the component should store formulas read from Xls files and write them back when saving the file.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true allows you to load existing XLS files, modify the values in some cells, and save the file preserving the formulas. This is the default setting.

Setting this property to false causes the component to remove the formulas in the book when it is loaded. Saving the file in this case will retain the last calculated values but will remove the formulas.
The component does not provide any support for creating or editing formulas. Formulas must be created in Excel.
Assigning any value to a cell will clear the formula in the cell.

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.XLShape
member.summary: Represents a shape embedded in a .

remarks.para: Excel sheets may contain many types of embedded shapes, including images, graphical elements, controls, and comments.

The XLShape abstract class contains information that is common to all shape types, including the shape's location (, , , , ), the type of border drawn around the shape (, , ), the applied to the shape, and information.
The class derives from XLShape and is used to embed images in sheets.

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.XLCell
member.summary: Represents individual cells in a , and provides properties for getting and setting the cell , , and .

remarks.para: To create cells, use the indexer (Item property). If the cell already exists, the reference will be returned as usual. If not, the sheet will create the cell (as well as rows and columns if necessary) and will return a reference to the new cell.
Because it creates cells automatically, the indexer is especially useful when creating and populating sheets.

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.XLCell.SetValue(System.Object,C1.C1Excel.XLStyle)
member.summary: Sets the and properties of a cell.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLCell.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value stored in the cell.

remarks.para: The value may contain strings, numeric, boolean, , or null objects. Other types of object can't be saved into Excel files.

DateTime values are internally converted into doubles, and stored in the sheet as such. The only way to tell the difference between a DateTime value and a double in Excel is by way of the format associated with the cell ( property).

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLCell.Hyperlink
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies an action to take when the cell is clicked.

remarks.para: Hyperlinks may contain URLs that when clicked open a browser window and navigate to the specified site (for example, "http://www.componentone.com"). They may also contain references to files that are launched by the application associated with the file type (for example, "readme.doc"). Finally, hyperlinks can be used to send e-mails (for example, "mailto:joe@foo.com").
Each cell may contain a hyperlink and a value. However, if you assign a hyperlink to a cell that has no value ( == null), then the hyperlink text is automatically assigned to the cell value as well.

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings
member.summary: Provides options and settings for printing objects.

remarks.para: The settings are applied to each sheet, and are accessible through the sheet's property.
Note that does not provide any printing services. The settings are used when printing the sheet from Excel.

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be displayed as a page header when the sheet is printed.
member.remarks:
The header string may contain special commands, i.e. placeholders for the page number, current date, or text formatting attributes. Most of these fields are represented by single letters with a leading ampersand ("&").
The page header is divided into 3 sections: left, center, and right. Each section is introduced by a special command ("&L", "&C", and "&R"). All text and all commands following are part of the selected section.
The following commands are available:
&L Start of the left section
&C Start of the centered section
&R Start of the right section
&P Current page number
&N Page count
&D Current date
&T Current time
&A Sheet name
&F File name without path
&Z File path without file name
&G Picture (file name)
&B Bold toggle
&I Italic toggle
&U Underline toggle
&E Double underline toggle
&S Strikeout toggle
&X Superscript toggle
&Y Subscript toggle
&"[fontname]" Set new font
&"[fontname,fontstyle]" Set new font with specified style. The style is in most cases "Regular", "Bold", "Italic", or "Bold Italic". &[fontheight] Set font height in points.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.Footer
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be displayed as a page header when the sheet is printed.
member.remarks: The footer string has the same structure and embedded commands as the header string. See the property for details.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the sheet should be centered horizontally on the page when printed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the left margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.summary: Gets or sets the right margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.summary: Gets or sets the top margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.summary: Gets or sets the header margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.MarginFooter
member.summary: Gets or sets the footer margin, in inches. Set to a negative value to use the default margin.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.PrintHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets whether row and column headers (the areas with row numbers and column letters) will be printed.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the gridlines will be printed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.PaperKind
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper size to use when printing the sheet.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.ScalingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor (in percent) to use when printing the sheet.
member.remarks: Setting the property automatically sets the property to false, causing C1Excel to use the selected scaling factor and to ignore the value of the and properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.AutoScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling mode used for printed output.

remarks.para: If is set to true, then the printed sheet will be automatically scaled to fit the number of pages specified by the and properties.
If is set to false, then the printed sheet will be scaled according to the value of the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.StartPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial page number to use when printing the sheet.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.FitPagesAcross
member.summary: Fit the sheet to this number of pages across (0 means use as many as needed).
member.remarks: Causes C1Excel to select "fit to page" print mode, ignoring the value of the property. Setting the or properties automatically sets the property to true, causing C1Excel to calculate the scaling factor based on the given number of pages and to ignore the value of the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.FitPagesDown
member.summary: Fit the sheet to this number of pages down (0 means use as many as needed).
member.remarks: Setting the or properties automatically sets the property to true, causing C1Excel to calculate the scaling factor based on the given number of pages and to ignore the value of the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.Copies
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of copies to print.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.PrintPagesInRows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to print the pages in rows (across first) or in columns (down first).

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.Landscape
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to print the sheet in landscape mode.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.BlackAndWhite
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to print the sheet in monochrome mode.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLPrintSettings.DraftQuality

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet
member.summary: Represents individual worksheets in an Excel workbook ().
member.remarks: Provides indexers to get or set the value of individual cells () and to access the and on the sheet.

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.GetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a reference to a cell at the specified coordinates, or null of the cell doesn't exist.
member.returns: A reference to the object at the specified coordinates, or null if there is no cell at the specified position.

remarks.para: To populate new sheets, use the indexer instead.
The indexer will automatically create new rows, columns, and cells as needed, and will never return null.

member.name: M:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of this sheet.
member.returns: A new object with the same contents and formatting as this sheet.

remarks.para: After cloning a sheet, you must rename it and then add it to the book (duplicate names are not allowed).
This method is useful for applications that generate books with a large number of similar sheets.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Book
member.summary: Gets a reference to the that owns the sheet.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the .

remarks.para: When you open a workbook in Excel, the sheet names appear in the tabs below the work area.
Sheet names can be used as indexers, so they should be unique.

member.summary: Gets a reference to sheet's row collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Columns

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.MergedCells
member.summary: Gets a that contains the collection of cells that are merged on the sheet.
member.remarks: The collection has methods for inspecting, adding, or clearing merged ranges in a sheet. Each merged range is represented by a object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.DefaultRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the default row height for the sheet (in twips).

remarks.para: You can set the height of individual rows using the class. Any rows that do not have a custom height assigned to them will be displayed using the sheet's .
The property is expressed in twips (1/20th of a point), rather than pixels. This allows sheets to maintain their aspect regardless of the resolution of the display.
To convert twips into pixels, use the method in . To convert pixels into twips, use the method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.DefaultColumnWidth

remarks.para: You can set the width of individual rows using the class. Any columns that do not have a custom width assigned to them will be displayed using the sheet's .
The property is expressed in twips (1/20th of a point), rather than pixels. This allows sheets to maintain their aspect regardless of the resolution of the display.
To convert twips into pixels, use the method in . To convert pixels into twips, use the method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the cell at a specified position on the sheet, creating a new cell if necessary.

remarks.para: If the specified cell doesn't exist when the indexer is invoked, the sheet will be expanded and a new cell will be created, then returned. This makes it easy to create and populate sheets.
If you want to determine whether a specific cell has been defined, use the method instead.
The indexer is generally more useful when creating and populating sheets. The method is more useful when loading existing sheets.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the sheet is locked for editing.

remarks.para: Sheets and styles can be locked. By default, sheets are unlocked and styles are locked. This combination allows users to edit the cells in Excel.
To protect a cell against editing in Excel, both the sheet and the cell style must have the property set to true.
To lock most cells on a sheet and allow editing of only a few cells, lock the sheet, then create an unlocked style and assign it to the cells that should be editable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the sheet's visibility.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Excel should show the row and column headers when displaying the sheet.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLSheet.GridColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to display gridlines.

remarks.para: Set this property to Color.Transparent to display the grid lines using the default color.
To hide the grid lines, set the property to false.

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.SharedStringTable
member.summary:
SharedStringTable is an ArrayList that contains a Hashtable helper.
The Hashtable contains pairs (string, index) and is used for two purposes:
1) To prevent the addition of duplicate values to the list. The Add method looks up values in the hashtable and only adds new values.
2) To provide a quick IndexOf override. The index is retrieved from the Hashtable instead of using the slow default linear search.
This new implementation reduces the time needed to save a 10,000 x 20 sheet from 650 seconds down to 16, essentially the same amount of time needed to save numbers.

member.name: T:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle
member.summary: Contains style elements used to define the appearance of the cells.

remarks.para: Each object may define one or more of the following elements: font, format, background color, background pattern, foreground color, alignment, text direction, and word wrapping.

When displaying a cell, Excel combines the row, column, and cell styles and merges the style elements defined in each one in order to determine how the cell should be displayed. The precedence of the styles is: (1) cell, (2) row, (3) column, (4) default style.
Every belongs to a , and may be assigned to one or more , , and objects through their property.

member.remarks: Set the property to null in order to suppress this style element and use the default font instead. The default font is determined by the book's property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color for this .

remarks.para: Set the property to Color.Transparent to suppress this style element and use the default foreground color instead (black).

All colors on the are mapped onto a palette. This means that is you assign colors to styles, save the book, and then load it back, you probably won't get exactly the same colors used when the book was created. You will get a fairly close approximation though.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for this .

remarks.para: Set the property to Color.Transparent to suppress this style element and use the default background color instead (white).

All colors on the are mapped onto a palette. This means that is you assign colors to styles, save the book, and then load it back, you probably won't get exactly the same colors used when the book was created. You will get a fairly close approximation though.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format associated with this .

remarks.para: Excel uses formats similar, but not identical to .NET. Refer to the Excel documentation for details on how to create format strings.
You can use the and methods to convert common Excel format strings to and from .NET format strings.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.AlignHorz
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment for this .
member.remarks: Set the property to to suppress this style element and use the default horizontal alignment instead ().

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.AlignVert
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment for this .
member.remarks: Set the property to to suppress this style element and use the default horizontal alignment instead ().

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this causes cell contents to wrap.
member.remarks: Cells that do not wrap will spill onto adjacent cells, and will be kept on a single line even if they contain line-break characters.

member.name: P:C1.C1Excel.XLStyle.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation for this , in degrees.

remarks.para: This property should be set to values between 0 and 180, or 255, as explained below:
Zero means no rotation.
1-90 means 1 to 90 degrees counter-clockwise (90 causes text to be displayed in the vertical direction going up the cell).
91-180 means 1 to 90 degrees clockwise (180 causes text to be displayed in the vertical direction going down the cell).
255 causes letters are stacked top to bottom and not rotated.

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.DrawString(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int32,System.Drawing.StringFormat)
member.summary: Draws the specified text string in the specified rectangle with the specified and objects using the formatting attributes of the specified object.
member.param: object that defines the appearance and size of the drawn text.
object that defines the color of the drawn text.
structure that specifies the location of the drawn text, in points from the top left corner of the page.
object that specifies formatting attributes applied to the drawn text.
Index of the first character that will be rendered.
member.returns: The index of first character that was not printed because it did not fit in the specified rectangle.

remarks.para: The contains properties that specify formatting options. Use the property to specify horizontal alignment and the property to specify vertical alignment.
Use the property to specify clipping and wrapping.

To render text in the vertical direction, use the . By itself, this flag will cause text to render from the bottom to the top of the rectangle. Combined with the flags, it will cause text to render from the top to the bottom of the rectangle.

The DrawString method returns the index of the first character that was not printed because it did not fit the output rectangle. You can use this value make text flow from page to page, or from one frame to another within a page.

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.DrawStringRtf(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Draws an Rtf string in the specified rectangle with the specified and objects.
member.param: object that defines the appearance and size of the drawn text.
object that defines the color of the drawn text.
structure that specifies the location of the drawn text, in points from the top left corner of the page.
member.returns: The index of first character that was not printed because it did not fit in the specified rectangle, or the value of int.MaxValue if the entire string was rendered.

remarks.para: This method is similar to , except it recognizes Rtf (Rich Text Format) strings like those used in the control.
There are two types of Rtf strings:

1) Complete Rtf strings contain an Rtf header that specifies the fonts and colors used within the string. These strings can be obtained from a control using the property, or from Rtf files saved to disk. In this case, the and parameters are not used.

2) Partial Rtf strings contain embedded Rtf tags but no Rtf header. These strings are easy to build in code and can be used to render text with special attributes such as bold and italics (for example: "this text contains {\b BOLD} and {\i ITALICS}". In this case, the and parameters are used to build the Rtf header automatically.

The DrawStringRtf method returns the index of the first character that was not printed because it did not fit the output rectangle. You can use this value make text flow from page to page, or from one frame to another within a page. To do this, use the overload that takes the starting character in the text as a parameter.

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.DrawStringRtf(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an Rtf string in the specified rectangle with the specified and objects, starting at a given offset within the string.
member.param: object that defines the appearance and size of the drawn text.
object that defines the color of the drawn text.
structure that specifies the location of the drawn text, in points from the top left corner of the page.
Index of the first character to draw (usually the return value of a previous call to DrawStringRtf).
member.returns: The index of first character that was not printed because it did not fit in the specified rectangle, or the value of int.MaxValue if the entire string was rendered.

remarks.para: This method is similar to , except it recognizes Rtf (Rich Text Format) strings like those used in the control.
There are two types of Rtf strings:

1) Complete Rtf strings contain an Rtf header that specifies the fonts and colors used within the string. These strings can be obtained from a control using the property, or from Rtf files saved to disk. In this case, the and parameters are not used.

2) Partial Rtf strings contain embedded Rtf tags but no Rtf header. These strings are easy to build in code and can be used to render text with special attributes such as bold and italics (for example: "this text contains {\b BOLD} and {\i ITALICS}". In this case, the and parameters are used to build the Rtf header automatically.

The DrawStringRtf method returns the index of the first character that was not printed because it did not fit the output rectangle. You can use this value make text flow from page to page, or from one frame to another within a page. Note that this value is not an index into the raw Rtf input, but into the text represented by the Rtf. See example below.

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.AddBookmark(System.String,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to the current page.
member.param: Text that appears on the outline tree.
Outline level (zero is the top level).
Position on the current page where the outline entry is located (in points).
member.remarks: Most long Pdf documents contain an outline structure that is displayed on a pane on the left of the reader. The outline makes it easy to browse through a document's structure and find specific topics. The AddBookmark method allows you to build this outline structure by adding outline entries (bookmarks).

member.remarks: Most long Pdf documents contain an outline structure that is displayed on a pane on the left of the reader. The outline makes it easy to browse through a document's structure and find specific topics. The AddBookmark method allows you to build this outline structure by adding outline entries (bookmarks).

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.AddLink(System.String,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Adds a hyperlink to the current page.
member.param: Link destination (can be a Url, a file name, or a local link destination).
Area on the page that will behave as a link (expressed in points, from the top-left corner of the page).

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.AddLink(System.String,System.Int32,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Adds a hyperlink to the document.
member.param: Link destination (can be a Url, a file name, or a local link destination).
Index of the page that contains the hyperlink
Area on the page that will behave as a link (expressed in points, from the top-left corner of the page).

remarks.para: Hyperlinks can be external (Urls and file names) or local (other locations within the same document).

Local links are useful when you want to implement some type of cross-referencing within the document, such as a table of contents or an index. Local links are identical to regular hyperlinks, except for two things:
1) The parameter must start with a "#", and
2) You must specify the target location for the link using the method.

Note that the AddLink method does not add any visible content to the page, so you will usually need another command along with AddLink to specify some text or an image that the user can see, as the example below demonstrates.

Area on the page that will behave as a target (in points from the top-left corner of the page).
member.remarks: This method is used to add targets for local hyperlinks. See the method for details and an example.

member.name: P:C1.C1Pdf.C1PdfDocument.CurrentPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the current page within the document.

remarks.para: The property determines which page of the document should receive the output from the methods that generate content (e.g. ).
The value is an integer ranging from -1 (no active page) to .-1.

You rarely have to use the property while creating a document. When a object is created, a blank page is automatically added and becomes the current page, so you can immediately start adding content to it. When the method is invoked, a new page is added to the document and becomes the current page.
The property is useful when you want to reopen pages that have already been generated and add content to them (for example, page headers and footers).

member.name: M:C1.C1Pdf.PdfPageCollection.Add(C1.C1Pdf.PdfPage)
member.summary: Adds a page to the document.
member.returns: The index of the new page in the document.

remarks.para: Since the class has no public constructors, the only way to use this overload is to remove an existing page from the document first, then add that page back into the document.
Each page can appear only once in the document. Trying to add the same page twice will throw an exception.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZStreamReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the underlying compressed stream, decompressing them into a buffer, then advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + ) replaced by the uncompressed data read from the stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of (decompressed) bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This may be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZStreamReader.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying stream.

summary.para: Closes the current stream compressor and flushed any pending data into the base stream.
If the property is set to True (the default value), then this method also closes the base stream and releases any resources (such as sockets and file handles) associated with it.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Output stream that will contain the compressed data.
Specifies whether the compressed stream should be compatible with zip files.

remarks.para: Streams in zip files are different from regular zlib streams in two aspects:
(1) zip streams do not contain any local header information (the information is stored in the zip file headers instead) and
(2) zip streams use a CRC32 checksum instead of the adler32 checksum used by zlib streams.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: The fields and must be initialized before by the caller.

inflateInit does not perform any decompression apart from reading the zlib header if present: data decompression is done by the method. Therefore, the next_in and avail_in may be modified, but next_out and avail_out are unchanged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.param: Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decompresses as much data as possible until the input buffer is exhausted or the output buffer is full.
member.param: How to flush data into the output buffer (default value is 2).
member.returns: Z_OK if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), Z_STREAM_END if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, Z_NEED_DICT if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, Z_DATA_ERROR if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the zlib format or incorrect checksum), Z_STREAM_ERROR if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if next_in or next_out was null), Z_MEM_ERROR if there was not enough memory, Z_BUF_ERROR if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when Z_FINISH is used.

remarks.para: inflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Decompress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to inflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. inflate provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer.

Before the call to inflate, the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly.
If inflate returns Zero and avail_out == 0, it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.
The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of inflate.
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point is found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence.
member.param: Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned Z_NEED_DICT. The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call to inflate.
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see the method).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer becomes empty or the output buffer becomes full.
member.param: Non-zero to force some data to be flushed into the output buffer.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: deflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Compress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in and avail_in are updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to deflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. This action is forced if the parameter is non zero. Forcing flush frequently degrades the compression ratio, so this parameter should be set only when necessary (in interactive applications). Some output may be provided even if flush is not set
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
If deflate returns with avail_out == 0, this method must be called again with the same value of the parameter and more output space until the flush is complete (deflate returns with avail_out != 0).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateParams(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dynamically updates the compression level and compression strategy.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the compression dictionary from the given byte sequence without producing any compressed output.
member.param: Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after , before any call to .
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see ).

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads count bytes from the stream with index as the starting point in the byte array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The starting point in the buffer at which to begin reading into the buffer.
The number of characters to read.
member.returns: The number of characters read into buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads count characters from the stream with index as the starting point in the character array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The starting point in the buffer at which to begin reading into the buffer.
The number of characters to read.
member.returns: The total number of characters read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of characters requested if that many characters are not currently available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadInt16
member.summary: Reads a 2-byte signed integer from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by two bytes.
member.returns: A 2-byte signed integer read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadInt32
member.summary: Reads a 4-byte signed integer from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by four bytes.
member.returns: A 4-byte signed integer read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadInt64
member.summary: Reads an 8-byte signed integer from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by four bytes.
member.returns: An 8-byte signed integer read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads the next byte from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by 1 byte.
member.returns: The next byte read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads count bytes from the current stream into a byte array and advances the current position by count bytes.
member.param: The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: A byte array containing data read from the underlying stream. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a Boolean from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by one byte.
member.returns: True if the byte is non-zero; otherwise false.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadChar
member.summary: Reads the next character from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the Encoding used and the specific character being read from the stream.
member.returns: A character read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadChars(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads count characters from the current stream, returns the data in a character array, and advances the current position in accordance with the Encoding used and the specific character being read from the stream.
member.param: The number of characters to read.
member.returns: A character array containing data read from the underlying stream. This might be less than the number of characters requested if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadSingle
member.summary: Reads a 4-byte floating point value from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by four bytes.
member.returns: A 4-byte floating point value read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadDouble
member.summary: Reads an 8-byte floating point value from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by eight bytes.
member.returns: An 8-byte floating point value read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadDecimal
member.summary: Reads a decimal value from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by sixteen bytes.
member.returns: An decimal value read from the current stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a String from the current stream. The String is prefixed with the length, encoded as an integer 7 bits at a time.
member.returns: The string being read.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryReader.Position
member.summary: Get or set the base stream position.

member.summary: Writes a one-byte Boolean value to the current stream, with zero representing false and one representing true.
member.param: The Boolean value to write (zero or one).

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned byte to the current stream and advances the stream position by one byte.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes a byte array to the underlying stream.
member.param: A byte array containing the data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Char)
member.summary: Writes a Unicode character to the current stream and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the Encoding used and the specific characters being written to the stream.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Char[])
member.summary: Writes a character array to the current stream and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the Encoding used and the specific characters being written to the stream.
member.param: A character array containing the data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Writes a decimal value to the current stream and advances the stream position by eight bytes.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes an eight-byte floating-point value to the current stream and advances the stream position by eight bytes.
member.param: The eight-byte floating-point value to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int16)
member.summary: Writes a two-byte signed integer to the current stream and advances the stream position by two bytes.
member.param: The two-byte signed integer to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a four-byte signed integer to the current stream and advances the stream position by four bytes.
member.param: The four-byte signed integer to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes an eight-byte signed integer to the current stream and advances the stream position by eight bytes.
member.param: The eight-byte signed integer to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.Single)
member.summary: Writes a four-byte floating-point value to the current stream and advances the stream position by four bytes.
member.param: The four-byte floating-point value to write.

The number of bytes to write.

member.summary: Writes a section of a character array to the current stream, and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the Encoding used and perhaps the specific characters being written to the stream.
member.param: A character array containing the data to write.

The number of characters to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Rtf.RtfBinaryWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a length-prefixed string to this stream in the current Encoding of the BinaryWriter, and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the Encoding used and the specific characters being written to the stream.
